entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 3:39PM EDT until August 28 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE NORTHEASTERN CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH... At 339 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding throughout the City of Virginia Beach. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. While the heaviest rain has ended, the threat for flash flooding will continue for a couple more hours.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany and western Laramie Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 229 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Baldy Peak, or 26 miles north of Laramie, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail.
